Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery type A cup; interior glazed black; exterior: from left, undetermined figure (foot remaining) to left followed by male, cloaked figure (torso and head missing; added red on cloak) to left; at right, bird standing to right (wing, tail feathers, and legs remaining; with added red on wing); below, wide and narrow bands above probable trace of black and red tongue pattern.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Musée du Louvre. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The suffix "5" was added by the British Museum's Naukratis cataloguing project to distinguish the sherd from the other am1371 sherds.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1430) (phase 3)
